column5: For action and function its the Johnson Silver Minnow. That being said, I think the hooks on them leave a lot to be desired. Once I sharpen them and take the plating off, the hook points just corrode down to a nub. I usually switch my spoons to a single hook and rip it out of the weeds when necessary.
I also have had my best luck in the weeds with a Johnson Silver Minnow (with or without a plastic trailer).
Moss Boss consistently gets it done for me in the slop
Well they are hard to buy/find (E-Bay or order from Europe) in the US, but the Rapala Rattlin Weedless Spoons are pretty awesome.https://www.rapala.com/eu-en/rapala/...+Spoon+EU.htmlBrett
Now that looks like a good bait, off to ebay i go

Harris Sports mail out of the UK I believe carry them too. Often offer free shipping too. Usually takes 2 weeks to the US. I prefer the largest size which is around 4in. The mid-size is around 3in and is a bit easier to find.Brett
****, they have a 4 inch? I only seen the 3 inch so that's what i ordered. Oh well they should work, hope so, they weren't cheap.

UGH! Sorry I didn't do this in the first place. Here is the source for the 10CM~4in Rapala Weedless spoons Scroll way down to bottom of the page to find the largest ones. I actually like the colors in the 3in rattling version better but like the size of this model better. Anyway. I have ordered from these guys too. Same deal about 2 weeks to get.https://www.lureshop.eu/rapala/minno...-weedless.htmlBrett
